    How to prepare images of different dimensions to all fit properly in a row?
    I have a lot of images for a portfolio site and I am trying to arrange them in rows such as the Omnifood Favorite Meals section. However, if I have CSS width: 100% and height: auto they are all jumbled up between the rows and not nicely lined up. How do I prepare/resize the images so that they don't lose their quality but all appear nicely in rows?

    What is the benefit of placing images inside UL tag?
    Hey Jonas! You've placed your images inside an un-ordered list. What is the benefit of doing so? Why can't we just float the FIGURE tags one next to each other?Also, i would like to know the benefit of having images placed whithin the FIGURE element, even though you haven't used any caption.

    Question added successfully

    We'll notify you of responses so you can mark them as helpful or as the answer to your question.

    If your question is more general in nature you can try searching Google, Quora, or StackExchange while you wait for the instructor or other students to help.

    why arent my images aligning correctly
    my images are appearing in 4rowX2Col instead of 3rowX4col, tried checking why this may be but couldnt pin-point the error. I have done a few things differently but i dont think that interferes with my "meals-section".  Some of these changes like my directories to CSS styling files etc was just changed so i can host the page on the microsoft server(for some reason it would not accept all those subfolders i had so i had to change a few things BUT DONT MIND THIS) YOU CAN CHECK OUT THE SITE ON "foodie.azurewebsites.net"(the site might not look good when you view it using your PC probably because I just recently uploaded a new version of it to the server, and the server is still loading the files eg all the CSS effects etc IN THIS CASE IT WOULD BE BETTER TO USE YOUR PHONE OR MAYBE EVEN TABLET  the phone seems to pick up faster on changes compared to PC)BUT THIS IS NOT WHAT IM SEEKING HELP ON, HOWEVER OVER THERE I DID MANAGE TO ALIGN THE  IMAGES CORRECTLY WITHOUT USING THE <FIGURE> ELEMENT ON EACH IMAGE, INSTEAD I DECIDED TO USE  THE <FIGURE> TO GROUP ALL IMAGES OF ONE <LI> (SO I JUST HAD 2 <FIGURE> ELEMENTS - 1 TO CONTAIN 4 IMAGES FROM EACH<LI>) BUT THEN THIS LED TO ERRORS WHEN DEALING WITH OVERFLOW ON EACH IMAGE SINCE THERE WAS NO CONTAINER TO HIDE THE OVERFLOW ETC :)  Images Aligned Incorrectly I can try and find a way around this buy it does not lead to desired outcome, The images will be inline and everything but when i now have to apply the overflow things just get messed up. So thats why i feel i have to do it the way Jonas does it. <!--  --HTML-- <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en">    <head>                <!--this stylesheet makes css look the same in all browsers and puts everything in place following recent web development standards-->        <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/normalize.css">                 <!--this is a for my grids, and their responiveness-->        <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/grid.css">                <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="cssr/style.css">                <!--chosen googleFonts with the types and italics etc whatever i chose-->        <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Ubuntu:300,300i,400" rel="stylesheet">                <!--icons-->        <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/ionicons.min.css">        </head>        <body>                <header>             <nav>                <div class="row">                     <img class="logo" src="images/logo-white.png">                    <ul class="main-nav">                        <li><a href="#">food delivery</a></li>                        <li><a href="#">how it works</a></li>                        <li><a href="#">Our Cities</a></li>                        <li><a href="#">Sign Up</a></li>                    </ul>                </div>            </nav>            <div class="hero-text-box">                <div class="row">                    <h1>Goodbye junk food. <br>Hello super healthy meals.</h1>                                        <a class="btn btn-full" href="#">I'm starving</a>                    <a class="btn btn-ghost" href="#">Show me more</a>                </div>            </div>        </header>                <section class="features-section">                        <div class="row">                <h2>Get food fast — not fast food</h2>                <p class="long-copy">                    Section 1: Features                    Title: Get food fast — not fast food.                     Hello, we’re Omnifood, your new premium food delivery service. We know you’re always busy. No time for cooking. So let us take care of that, we’re really good at it, we promise!                </p>            </div>                        <div class="row">                                <div class="col span-1-of-4 box">                    <i class="ion-ios-calendar icon-big"></i>                    <h3>Up to 365 days/year</h3>                    <p>                        Never cook again! We really mean that. Our subscription plans include up to 365 days/year coverage. You can also choose to order more flexibly if that's your style.                    </p>                </div>                                <div class="col span-1-of-4 box">                    <i class="ion-ios-stopwatch icon-big"></i>                    <h3>Ready in 20 minutes</h3>                    <p>                        You're only twenty minutes away from your delicious and super healthy meals delivered right to your home. We work with the best chefs in each town to ensure that you're 100% happy.                    </p>                </div>                                <div class="col span-1-of-4 box">                    <i class="ion-ios-nutrition icon-big"></i>                    <h3>100% organic</h3>                    <p>                        All our vegetables are fresh, organic and local. Animals are raised without added hormones or antibiotics. Good for your health, the environment, and it also tastes better!                    </p>                </div>                                <div class="col span-1-of-4 box">                    <i class="ion-ios-bell icon-big"></i>                    <h3>Order anything</h3>                    <p>                        We don't limit your creativity, which means you can order whatever you feel like. You can also choose from our menu containing over 100 delicious meals. It's up to you!                    </p>                </div>                            </div>                </section>                <section class="meals-section">            <ul class="meals-showcase">                <li>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/1.jpg" alt="Korean bibimbap with egg and vegetables">                    </figure>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/2.jpg" alt="Simple italian pizza with cherry tomatoes">                    </figure>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/3.jpg" alt="Chicken breast steak with vegetables">                    </figure>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/4.jpg" alt="Autumn pumpkin soup">                    </figure>                </li>            </ul>                                <ul class="meals-showcase">                <li>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/5.jpg" alt="Paleo beef steak with vegetables">                    </figure>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/6.jpg" alt="Healthy bouguette with egg and vegetables">                    </figure>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/7.jpg" alt="Burger with cheddar and bacon">                    </figure>                    <figure class="meal-photo-figure">                        <img src="images/8.jpg" alt="Granola with cherries and strawberries">                    </figure>                </li>            </ul>                    </section>          </body> </html> --CSS-- /*---------------------------*//*BASIC SETUP*//*---------------------------*/*{    /*1> try by all means to kill defualt browser stylings          2> set box sizing to border box so the when we size our boxes(divs) it applies to the border of the box inturn giving us more control over styling, do this for ALL boxes/divs*/        margin:0;    padding:0;        } html{    color:#575454;    font-family:'ubuntu','open sans condensed','sans-serif';    font-size:20px;    margin: 0 auto;        /*adding the font weight here is not neccessary since i on got one weigth from google fonts which is 400f    font-weight: 400;*/        /*this is just telling the browser how i want it to render/load eg do i want it to load fast or make sure all things are loaded then rather than just be speedy etc*/    text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;    font-weight:300;} /*---------------------------*//*REUSABLE COMPONENTS*//*---------------------------*/ .icon-big{    font-size:200%;    color:#e67e22;    margin:0 auto;} .box{    padding:0px;    }.box p{    line-height: 140%;    font-size:90%;} .long-copy{    line-height:145%;    width:70%;    margin:0 auto;} section{    padding:80px 0;} /*--------HEADING--------*/h1,h2,h3{        color:#909090;    font-weight:200;    text-transform:uppercase;} h1{    font-size:250%;    margin:0 0 20px 0;    word-spacing:0px;} h2{    font-size:180%;    text-align: center;    margin-bottom:30px;    word-spacing: 0px;} h3{    font-size:110%;    margin-bottom:10px;} h2:after{    display:block;    height:2px;    width:200px;    background-color:#e67e22;    content:"";    margin:20px auto;} /*--------BUTTONS--------*/.btn:link,.brn:visited{    display:inline-block;    padding:10px 30px;    text-decoration:none;    border:1px solid #e67e22;    border-radius:100px;    transition:background-color 0.4s, border 0.4s,color 0.4s;  } .btn-full:link,.btn-full:visited{    color:#fff;    background-color:#e67e22;    border-radius:50px;    margin-right:10px;    border:1px solid #e67e22;} .btn:hover,.btn:active{    background-color:#bf6516;    color:#fff;    border:1px solid #bf6516;    } .btn-ghost:link,.btn-ghost:visited{    color:#e67e22;} .btn-ghost:hover,.btn-ghost:active{    color:#fff;    } /*---------------------------*//*MEALS*//*---------------------------*/ .meals-showcase {    list-style: none;    width: 100%;    } .meals-showcase li {    display:block;    width: 25%;    float:left;} .meal-photo-figure {    width: 100%;    margin: 0;    overflow: hidden;    background-color: #000;} .meal-photo-figure img {    opacity: 0.7;    width: 100%;    height: auto;    transform: scale(1.15);    transition: transform .5s, opacity 0.5s; } .meal-photo-figure img:hover{    transform:scale(1.04);    opacity: 1;} /*---------------------------*//*HEADER CONTENTS*//*---------------------------*/header{    background-image:linear-gradient(rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.70),rgba(0, 0, 0, .70)),url(images/hero.jpg);    height:100vh;    background-size:cover;    } .hero-text-box {    position:absolute;    width:1140px;    top:50%;    left:50%;    transform: translate(-50%,-50%);} .row{    max-width:1140px;    margin:0 auto;} .logo{    max-height:100px;    width:auto;    float:left;} .main-nav{    float:right;    list-style:none;    margin-top:40px;} .main-nav li{    display:inline;    margin-left:40px;} .main-nav li a:link,.main-nav li a:visited{    color:#fff;    text-decoration:none;    text-transform:uppercase;    font-size:90%;    border-bottom:2px solid transparent;    transition:0.4s;   } .main-nav li a:hover{    border-color:#e67e22;    padding:0 0 10px 0;} -->
